dataservice-import.instructionsMsg: Select the source of the data service

dataservice-navbar.backToDashboardMsg: Click below to navigate back to the default Data Service dashboard.
dataservice-navbar.dataServiceActionsMsg: Choose from the actions below or jump directly to one of your starred/favorited Data Services.
dataservice-navbar.sourceActionsMsg: Choose from the actions below or jump directly to one of your starred/favorited Sources.

dataservice-new.configureSourceMsg: Before you can create a new Data Service, you will need to configure a data source. To configure a data source, click
dataservice-new.inputFieldsHelpMsg: Choose a name (and optional description) for your Data Service
dataservice-new.instructionsMsg: A Data Service can be composed of one or more of your available data sources. If you don't see your desired data source, click
dataservice-new.sourceTablesLimitedMsg: Limit your view definition to use the following tables:

dataservice-summary.connectionsNumberToolTip: The number of native data connections, eg. JDBC databases, utilised by this dataservice
dataservice-summary.createDataServiceMsg: A Data Service is created using one or more Data Sources. To create your first Data Service, click New Data Service below.
dataservice-summary.createSourceMsg: A Data Service is created using one or more Data Sources. To create your first Data Source, click
dataservice-summary.documentationDataServiceMsg: Documentation such as how to connect to your data service and client examples are available here.
dataservice-summary.importDataServiceMsg: You can also import an existing Data Service. To import a Data Service, click
dataservice-summary.noDataServiceImportMsg: You can also import an existing Data Service. To import an existing Data Service, click Import Data Service below.
dataservice-summary.noSourcesOrDataServicesExist: No Data Sources or Data Services Found
dataservice-summary.noSourcesMsg: In order to create a data service you need a data source. To get started, click Configure Data Source below to create your first data source.
dataservice-summary.serviceVdbToolTip: The name of the service VDB of this dataservice

dataservice-documentation.connecting-heading1: There are multiple ways to connect to your data service including JDBC, ODBC, OData, REST or SOAP.
dataservice-documentation.connecting-heading2: This is meant to give you a starting point. Please see the documentation for more details.
dataservice-documentation.connecting-java1: To connect to your service using JDBC, use the following connection string in your client: {{connection_string}}
dataservice-documentation.connecting-java2: See the client code example tab for a sample implementation.
dataservice-documentation.connecting-odata1: Deployed services are accessible using OData URLs. This service's metadata is accessible via: {{url}}.
dataservice-documentation.connecting-odata2: The service is protected using HTTP Basic security and requires the user to have a role of 'odata' defined for OData access.

dataservice-test.enterQueryMsg: Enter an SQL query to test the Data Service
dataservice-test.failedDeploymentMsg: The Data Service could not be deployed:
dataservice-test.selectResultLimitMsg: Select the number of results to be initially returned
dataservice-test.selectViewMsg: Select the view to be queried
dataservice-test.selectViewPlaceholder: Select a view in the list...

help.endpointSubmit:
'

This URL is formed using the OData specification. It can be copied into a new browser window to return the results in xml format or append ?format=json to the URL for JSON.

Click the Submit button to display the results in a formatted table.

'
help.select:
'

Choose the view from which results should be sought.

Select a limit to curtail the number of results returned

'
help.columns: Select the columns to be included in the results.
help.where:
'

Create where clauses for filtering the results based on the values in each tuple.

Use the + button to add new where clauses (clauses are and-ed together) and remove them with the - buttons.

'
help.orderBy: Sort the results by column in ascending or descending order.
help.resultsTable:
'

Use the column headers to sort the results or filter them by entering values.

Results are paginated in blocks of 25 and can be scrolled through with the controls at the foot of the table.

'
help.resultsRaw:
'

The raw data as returned from the odata teiid service in json format.

'
help.sqlSearch:
'

Use the Teiid dialect of SQL to construct a query that interrogates the data service for data results.

Use the record limit to limit the number of results returned.

Set the starting record index to fetch a subset of results starting at the given row index.

'

fileImportControl.fileApisNotSupportedMsg: The File APIs are not fully supported in this browser. Cannot proceed with import.
fileImportControl.fileLockedMsg: The file '{{fileName}}' is in a locked state
fileImportControl.fileReadAbortedMsg: The file '{{fileName}}' Read operation was aborted
fileImportControl.invalidFileTypeMsg: {{fileName}}'s file type is not valid hence the file cannot be imported.

file-import-wizard.importFromFileMsg: Import the dataservice from a file

gitCredentialsControl.authorEmailPlaceholder: Enter the email address of the author
gitCredentialsControl.authorNamePlaceholder: Enter the name of the author
gitCredentialsControl.fileApisNotSupportedMsg: The File APIs are not fully supported in this browser. Not able to read the file {{fileName}}
gitCredentialsControl.fileGenericeReadErrorMsg: The file encountered a generic read error
gitCredentialsControl.fileLockedMsg: The file is in a locked state
gitCredentialsControl.fileReadAbortedMsg: The file read operation was aborted
gitCredentialsControl.relativeFilePathPlaceholder: Enter the relative file path or the name of the destination file (**required**)
gitCredentialsControl.repositoryBranchPlaceholder: Enter git repository branch, eg. master
gitCredentialsControl.repositoryNamePlaceholder: Enter a name for this repository

help.authorEmail: Specifies the email address of the author to be used when commiting to the repository
help.authorName: Specifies the name of the author to be used when commiting to the repository
help.httpPassword: Specifies the password for HTTP authentication
help.hostsFileKeyAuthentication: Specifies the file containing the ssh known hosts for key-based authentication
help.hostsFilePasswordAuthentication: Specifies the file containing the ssh known hosts for password-based authentication
help.passphrase: Specifies the ssh passphrase for key-based authentication
help.privateKeyFile: Specifies the file containing the ssh private key for key-based authentication
help.relativePath: The relative (to the repository root directory) path of the file. It is enough to specify only the name of the file.
help.repositoryBranch: The branch that should be checked out of the repository. If not specified then the  master branch is assumed.
help.repositoryName: A name to identify this git repository
help.repositoryUrl: The URL location of the git repository to use as the destination storage
help.sshPassword: Specifies the ssh password for password-based authentication
help.userName: Specifies the user name for HTTP authentication

git-import-wizard.extractStepMsg: Import the artifact from the repository
git-import-wizard.repositoryDetailsStepMsg: Enter the details for the source git repository

help.recordOffset: Sets the index of the first record returned (0 for no offset)
